Scope and Contents Note
The collection includes the work of photographers Louis Faurer (1916-2001) and Arnold Newman (1918-2006) and artist Vincent D. Smith (1929-2003). Faurer is represented by four images from 1950s New York City; Newman by eight undated portraits; and Smith by a signed suite of prints of eight of his etchings from 1965-1966 concerning African-American life and racial animosity. Further details on the individual photographs and the suite of etchings are detailed below in the container list.

Scope and Contents Note
Includes a cased suite of etchings printed on Arches paper in 1994 by Kelly Driscoll at the Printmaking Workshop under the supervision of Robert Blackburn and the artist. Suite is number 27/40. Pages signed by artist and noted AP. Published by G.W. Einstein Company, Inc. The etchings are titled "Dispossess," Shadows in Harlem," The Man in Harlem," "Mississippi Incident," "Down on the Farm," "First Day of School," "Housing Northern[?] Style," and "The Long Hot Summer."
